alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Henry and northeastern Houston Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 409 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Webb, or near Dothan, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Headland, Dothan, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Avon, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Pearce, Enon, Wilson Mill, Barber, Pleasant Plains, Ardilla, Farley Nuclear Plant and Smyrna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
